intro: Synaedrys clementis, commonly known as the Clementine spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and often striking floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture, and it produces small, clustered flowers. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity requires caution in handling.
